page.title: 04Tourism at Painswick
page.content: Painswick is often called the 'Queen of the Cotswolds'.It is 500 feet above sea level in an area of outstanding natural beauty.There are very good views of the county from Painswick Beacon.The Falcon Bowling Green is reputed to be the best and oldest in England and is well known to players throughout the country.Other areas include:Rugby and cricket pitches and two tennis courts. The iron stocks on the churchyard wall in St. Marys street are 17th century ,and one of only two such examples in the country. On the Sunday after Sept. 19th the medieval clipping ceremony is held.The parishoners process through the church yard.The children join hands circling the church and singing a hymn.It gets its name from the Anglo_Saxon word{ 'Clyppan'_to embrace. The Tourist Office is in the library.
